ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I guess its valuable doing a capstone project that is more extended in duration but I don't think I got that much out of it.
It was excellent to be able to apply the mathematical concepts I learned to an independent project t
It was an interesting problem to work on and I enjoyed working with my professor.

I think I learned a ton through the senior project. I definitely learned material specific to my project, but I think that's the point of the class, and I think that as the semester went on, I got better at teaching myself the material that I needed to know.
Learned research skills, how to write a more formal paper, and a whole lot about neural nets.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think more structure and guidelines would be helpful but it is also nice that it is very open-ended. The process of finding an advisor is important and should be stressed more by the DUS for students to do that sooner.
The course could benefit from a bit more structure, such as having more deadlines/checkpoints throughout the semester, and more involvement from the DUS.
Strengths: it is a great way to purpose ones interests. Weakness: it is very much dependent on the student advisor relationship
More communication about expectations/deadlines would be good.
I think this course is what you make of it. I think I realized that early on, and I knew that the more work I did the more I would learn. That said, I have no specific suggestions for improving it.
Some more guidance from the Applied Math department could have made the experience smoother and more rewarding.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: You have to. The seminar is probably a waste of time so do this instead
The senior project is a ton of work so due it in the fall if possible! It would be nice of the department gave a bit more guidance about the project.
Yes! A senior project is an excellent capstone

AMTH 491 is a great course to delve into an area of interest and spend a lot of time on it. I think you definitely get out of it as much as you put into it, which is something to consider when choosing a project. Your choice of advisor also makes a huge difference in your experience, so it's important to find someone who is as interested in your project as you are and wants to help you figure stuff out.
A requirement for Applied Math majors. Would recommend, but make sure to find an adviser quickly and think about truly interesting projects.
